description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on Jersey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 21-25 September
title_page: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 21-25 September - BBC News
maintext:
Jersey Heritage is extending its winter hours as a thank you to its members who kept on visiting in the past few months to support the island's castles and museums.
Hamptonne Country Life Museum was due to close for the season this weekend but will now remain open daily from 10:00 to 16:00 until the end of the year. All of the other heritage sites were going to switch to winter hours from 1 November. They too will now stay open between 10:00 and 16:00 until 30 December.
Google Copyright: Google
Elizabeth Castle will close on 1 November as access greatly relies on fair weather.
Louise Downie, Jersey Heritage¡¯s director of curation and experience, said: ¡°We want to say a big thank you to all our loyal members, who have been incredibly supportive during this difficult time.
"Our visitor numbers over the summer season have been decimated by the coronavirus pandemic but members, new and old, have flocked to our sites, with the number of their visits nearly doubling, compared to last year."
